Course Description: This is a 4 credit core course for second year undergraduate ECE students. The objectives of the course are to develop problem solving skills related to transient, sinusoidal and frequency-domain circuit analysis techniques. The lab component of the course will develop skills related to design, simulation, fabrication and testing of simple circuits.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Perform AC power analysis for single, polyphase and magnetically coupled circuits.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Apply circuit analysis techniques (mesh, nodal, superposition, source transformation) to analyze complex circuits.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Use Laplace transforms and Fourier series for analyzing simple circuits and two-port networks.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Design, simulate, fabricate and test simple circuits.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Review of Resistors, Inductors and Capacitors, Basic RL and RC circuits (First Order Circuits)

RLC Circuits - Source free series and parallel circuits, Complete response of RLC circuits, Second order Op Amp Circuits, Lab: Introduction to reading datasheets for component selection and circuit design
Sinusoidal Steady state analysis - Complex forcing function, sinusoids, the phasor, impedance and admittance, Lab: Preliminary schematic of circuit design on LTSpice

AC Circuits: Impedance Combinations, Nodal and Mesh Analysis, Superposition Theorem, Source Transformation, Thevenin and Norton Equivalent Circuits. Lab: Simulate time-domain, frequency domain and noise performance of circuit, Learn how to use PCB design tool
AC Power Analysis: Instantaneous and Average Power, Maximum Average Power, Maximum Power Transfer, Apparent Power and Power Factor. Lab: Prepare the gerber file for the circuit design

Magnetically Coupled Circuits: Mutual Inductance, Energy in a Coupled Circuit, Linear and Ideal Transformers, Transformer as an Isolation Device, Transformer as a Matching Device. Lab: Solder the components on the PCB

Intro to Laplace transforms: Properties, Inverse Laplace transform (Simple, Repeated and Complex Poles), Convolution Integral, Circuit Element Models, Circuit Analysis, Transfer Functions, State Variables. Lab: Test the performance of the circuit

Frequency Response: Transfer Function, Bode Plot, Series Resonance, Parallel Resonance, Passive and Active Filters. Scaling (Magnitude, Frequency, Magnitude and Frequency), Filter Design. Lab: Test the performance of the circuit

Two-port networks: Two port parameters (Impedance, Admittance, Transmission, Scattering), Cascading of 2 port Networks. Lab: Submit final report (bill-of-materials, schematic, super-posed simulation and measurement results)
Network Stability, Network Synthesis, Fourier Series, Symmetry, Filters, Circuit Analysis using Fourier Transforms

Resource Material.Textbook: Engineering Circuit Analysis, 8th edition, Hayt, Kemmerly, Durbin
